intro: Jatropha erythropoda var. hirtula, commonly known as the hairy redleaf jatropha, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-veined leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are not suitable for human consumption. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry woodlands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in warm climates.
